fields.description: Spatial juniper data for showing detailed information for juniper extents.
fields.name: Juniper

fields.description: Spatial data showing sage grouse core habitat, sage grouse low density habitat, and pygmy rabbit habitat in Eastern Oregon.
fields.name: Species

fields.description: Spatial data for datasets that were used to calculate costs.
fields.name: Areas to Avoid/Costs

fields.description: Areas of Critical Environmental Concern (ACEC) summarized to the planning unit.  This serves as a visual aid to determine the spatial variation of ACEC areas within various planning units across the geography of interest.
fields.name: Areas of Critical Environmental Concern

fields.description: This data set shows the distribution of Areas of Critical Environmental Concern (ACEC) under BLM management in Oregon.
fields.name: Areas of Critical Environmental Concern

fields.description: This data set represents completed biological land treatments for BLM managed lands in the states of Oregon. Biological treatments are the introduction of foraging species, predators or parasites to control plant or animal pests, or to selectively suppress or remove vegetation.
fields.name: BLM Biological Treatment Areas

fields.description: This data set represents completed burn land treatments on BLM managed lands in the states of Oregon. Burn treatments are prescribed burning of wild land fuels in either their natural or modified state, and under specified environmental conditions.
fields.name: BLM Burn Treatment Areas

fields.description: This data set represents completed chemical land treatments on BLM managed lands in the states of Oregon. Chemical treatments are applications of herbicide or pesticide, to control or kill pests and invasive plants, or fertilizer to enhance plant growth.
fields.name: BLM Chemical Treatment Areas

fields.description: This data set shows the livestock grazing allotments managed by the BLM.
fields.name: BLM Grazing Allotments

fields.description: This data set represents completed harvest land treatments on BLM managed lands in the states of Oregon. Harvest treatments are the cutting and removal or trees or biomass.
fields.name: BLM Harvest Treatment Areas

fields.description: This data set delineates BLM owned lands in the state of Oregon.
fields.name: BLM Lands

fields.description: This data set represents completed mechanical treatments on BLM managed lands in the states of Oregon. Mechanical treatments are 1.) machine and manual methods of area treatment; 2.) pulling, piling, chopping, grinding, or mowing treatments to consolidate, reduce or clear live or dead vegetation (might be grass, brush, small trees, stump removal), as well as "Cut-Leave" of trees, and soil preparation such as plowing or ripping.
fields.name: BLM Mechanical Treatment Areas

fields.description: This data set represents completed treatments involving fenced enclosures or protective devices on trees or soil surfaces on BLM managed lands in the states of Oregon. The entire area is considered "treated" with protection measures.
fields.name: BLM Protection Treatment Areas

fields.description: This data set represents completed re-vegetation treatments on BLM managed lands in the states of Oregon. Re-vegetation treatments are re-vegetation by planting or seeding.
fields.name: BLM Revegetation Treatment Areas

fields.description: Publication data set showing Visual Resource Inventory (VRI) classes for BLM managed lands in Oregon. The classes are based on scenic quality, sensitivity level, and distance zones.
fields.name: BLM Visual Resource Inventory Publication Areas

fields.description: Publication data set showing Visual Resource Management (VRM) classes for BLM managed lands in Oregon. VRM classes are determined through the land use planning process.
fields.name: BLM Visual Resource Management Publication Areas

fields.description: BLM wilderness characteristic areas summarized to the planning unit.  This serves as a visual aid to determine the spatial variation of wilderness characteristic areas within various planning units across the geography of interest.
fields.name: BLM wilderness characteristics areas

fields.description: This data set shows the polygons for wilderness characteristics areas. Areas of BLM land are evaluated for wilderness characteristics based on size, naturalness and outstanding opportunities for solitude and primitive and unconfined recreation criteria. The theme represents an inventory of wilderness characteristics found, or not found, on BLM lands.
fields.name: BLM Wilderness Characteristics Areas

fields.description: This data set shows the Congressionally designated BLM Wilderness areas. In-holdings are identified.
fields.name: BLM Wilderness Lands

fields.description: BLM Wilderness Lands summarized to the planning unit.  This serves as a visual aid to determine the spatial variation of Wilderness Lands within various planning units across the geography of interest.
fields.name: BLM Wilderness Lands

fields.description: This data set shows the Wilderness Study Areas as inventoried in the mid-1980's and precisely defined in the Oct.1991 "Wilderness Study Report" and/or on USGS 7.5 minute quad maps. There have also been a few changes to WSAs since the 1991 report. WSAs are essentially roadless areas under BLM jurisdiction. WSAs have special management restrictions and priorities.
fields.name: BLM Wilderness Study Areas

fields.description: BLM Wilderness Study Areas summarized to the planning unit.  This serves as a visual aid to determine the spatial variation of Wilderness Study Areas within various planning units across the geography of interest.
fields.name: BLM Wilderness Study Areas

fields.description: The intent of this data set is to provide baseline data for wild horse and burro management on BLM lands. The herd areas depicted are the original herd areas and may not represent current herd management areas.
fields.name: BLM Wild Horse and Burro Herd Areas

fields.description: This data set shows Congressionally designated areas of land to which specific laws and regulations pertaining to the management of wild horses and burros are applied.
fields.name: BLM Wild Horse and Burro Herd Management Areas

fields.description: This data shows the names and locations of Oregon cities and towns.  The data is scale dependent, meaning you will see more details as you zoom into the map.  For example, when zoomed out to the Oregon scale you will see only Portland labeled.  As you zoom in to the map additional cities will appear such as Salem, Eugene, Vancouver, etc.  This data was derived from the U.S. National Atlas Cities data, originated by the National Atlas of the United States and the United States Geological Survey, and provided by ESRI.
fields.name: Cities

fields.description: Ecotrust base map showing topography, major waterbodies and city boundaries.
fields.name: Ecotrust Base Map

fields.description: ESRI base map showing satellite imagery.
fields.name: ESRI Satellite Map

fields.description: ESRI topo base map showing major mountain ranges, cities, and interstate/ highways.
fields.name: ESRI Topo Map

fields.description: Google base map showing highways and cities.
fields.name: Google Base Map

fields.description: This data set shows the historic extent of juniper trees as determined by employees of the Pacific Northwest Forest Experiment Station (now called the Pacific Northwest Research Station) in the early 1930's.
fields.name: Historic Juniper Extent

fields.description: This data set is used for tracking of noxious weed infestations to aid in prevention and control of establishment and spread.
fields.name: Invasive Weeds

fields.description: Juniper Phase 1 areas summarized to the planning unit.  This serves as a visual aid to determine the spatial variation of Juniper Phase 1 areas within various planning units across the geography of interest.
fields.name: Juniper Phase 1

fields.description: This data set shows the current extent of juniper trees classified as phase 1, the early stage of encroachment.  The data was derived from ILAP (Integrated Landscape Assessment Project) data developed by the Institute for Natural Resources (INR).
fields.name: Juniper Phase 1

fields.description: Juniper Phase 2 areas summarized to the planning unit.  This serves as a visual aid to determine the spatial variation of Juniper Phase 2 areas within various planning units across the geography of interest.
fields.name: Juniper Phase 2

fields.description: This data set shows the current extent of juniper trees classified as phase 2, the mid-successional stage of encroachment.  The data was derived from ILAP (Integrated Landscape Assessment Project) data developed by the Institute for Natural Resources (INR).
fields.name: Juniper Phase 2

fields.description: Juniper Phase 3 areas summarized to the planning unit.  This serves as a visual aid to determine the spatial variation of Juniper Phase 3 areas within various planning units across the geography of interest.
fields.name: Juniper Phase 3

fields.description: This data set shows the current extent of juniper trees classified as phase 3, where juniper fully dominate the area.  The data was derived from ILAP (Integrated Landscape Assessment Project) data developed by the Institute for Natural Resources (INR).
fields.name: Juniper Phase 3

fields.description: U.S. Major Highways represents the major highways of the United States. These include interstates, U.S. highways, state highways and major roads.
fields.name: Major USA Highways

fields.description: Mapbox base map showing topography, interstates/highways, cities, major waterbodies and National Forests.
fields.name: Mapbox Terrain Map

fields.description: National Geographic base map tiles.
fields.data_source: National Geographic, Esri, DeLorme, NAVTEQ, UNEP-WCMC, USGS, NASA, ESA, METI, NRCAN, GEBCO, NOAA, iPC
fields.name: National Geographic Base Map

fields.description: This data set shows the biomass resource potential for forest residues for the selected counties in Oregon as determined by the National Renewable Energy Lab.  This category includes logging residue and other removable material left after carrying out silviculture operations and site conservations.  Logging residue comprises unused portions of trees, cut or killed by logging and left in the woods.  Other removable materials are the unutilized volume of trees cut or killed during logging operations.  Source: USDA, Forest Service's Timber Product Output database, 2007.
fields.name: NREL Biomass Resource Potential

fields.description: OpenStreetMap base map showing terrain and major waterbodies.
fields.data_source: Data, imagery and map information provided by OpenStreetMap and contributors, CC-BY-SA
fields.name: OpenStreetMap Terrain Map

fields.description: Planning unit boundaries derived from the National Watershed Boundary Dataset (WBD) at the 5th field HUC (hydrologic boundary units) or "watershed" scale.  The data was provided by the Natural Resources Conservation Service, the Environmental Protection Agency, and the United States Geological Survey.
fields.name: Planning Units

fields.description: This data set shows primary named rivers of Oregon.  The data is derived from the National Hydrography Dataset (NHD), the standard system used to identify the U.S. surface water.
fields.name: Primary Rivers

fields.description: This data set is an extraction from PAD-US 1.1 (CBI Edition), by state. The PAD-US 1.1 (CBI Edition) data set portrays the nation's protected areas with a standardized spatial geometry and numerous valuable attributes on land ownership, management designations, and conservation status (using national GAP and international IUCN coding systems). The PAD-US 1.1 (CBI Edition) defines protected areas to include all lands dedicated to the preservation of biological diversity and to other natural, recreation and cultural uses, and managed for these purposes through legal or other effective means (adapted from IUCN definition).
fields.name: Protected Areas

fields.description: Publication transportation data set showing both BLM inventoried and non-inventoried roads in Oregon. This data does not include highways and is meant to assist with determining access to juniper.  Data only shows when zoomed in to specific planning unit.
fields.name: Public Roads by Ownership

fields.description: This data set includes buffered points of all BLM field observations of pygmy rabbit burrows, sightings and observation locations from 2001 to 2007 within the state of Oregon boundaries. Locations are from BLM employees and BLM contractors or cooperating agencies. The locations were coordinated mostly within the Lake View BLM District in southeast Oregon. Data is known to be incomplete.
fields.name: Pygmy Rabbit Habitat

fields.description: This data set shows primary rivers, named streams/creeks, and canals. Zoom in to see river names. The data is derived from the National Hydrography Dataset (NHD), the standard system used to identify the U.S. surface water.
fields.name: Rivers/Streams/Canals

fields.description: Preliminary draft data used for analysis in Sage-Grouse Resource Management Plan - Plan Amendments (SG RMP PA) that displays Preliminary General Habitat (PGH) as directed by BLM Instruction Memorandum No. 2012-044.
fields.name: Sage Grouse Preliminary General Habitat

fields.description: Preliminary draft data used for analysis in Sage-Grouse Resource Management Plan - Plan Amendments (SG RMP PA) that displays Preliminary Priority Habitat (PPH) as directed by BLM Instruction Memorandum No. 2012-044.
fields.name: Sage Grouse Preliminary Priority Habitat

fields.description: Slopes greater than 20% summarized to the planning unit.  This serves as a visual aid to determine the spatial variation of slopes greater than 20% within various planning units across the geography of interest.
fields.name: Slope greater than 20%

fields.description: This data set was derived from USGS National Elevation Data (10m DEM) for Oregon to show all slopes in eastern Oregon that are greater than 20%.
fields.name: Slopes Greater Than 20%

fields.description: This data set delineates USFWS owned lands in the state of Oregon.
fields.name: USFWS Lands

fields.description: Known Juniper Utilization Centers as of November, 2012.
fields.name: Utilization Centers

fields.description: Wetlands summarized to the planning unit.  This serves as a visual aid to determine the spatial variation of wetlands within various planning units across the geography of interest.
fields.name: Wetlands

fields.description: This data set represents the extent and approximate location of wetlands within Oregon. The data was derived from the National Wetland Inventory.
fields.name: Wetlands

fields.description: This data set shows the Wild and Scenic River Corridors on BLM managed lands within Oregon.
fields.name: Wild and Scenic Rivers
